name: ArsR+ – Diamide Stress
function: Detoxification in response to: oxidative protein damage, arsenic, catechol, copper, toxic quinones

name: Spβ-1 – SP-β Prophage 1
function: Temperature-responsive SP-beta prophage. Response to stressors such as cold and ethanol. Subset of  SPbeta Prophage 2.

name: MtlR / AnsR – Mannitol, Asparagine, and Aspartate
function: Uptake and utilization of mannitol, degradation of asparagine and aspartate

name: Noise – Diamide 15
function: Likely accounting for noise in the diamide after 15 minutes and LBG exponential conditions

name: Uncharacterized 2
function: Contains cold shock, sporulation onset, toxin, amino acid homeostasis, translataional, other proteins, many RNAs

name: StrRes – Translation
function: Production of ribosomes, translation initiation factors, ADP formation, protein processing and secretory machinery, DNA replication, RNA polymerase

name: Empty 1
function: Contains no genes

name: IolR / MelR – Inositol, Melibiose, and Acetoin
function: Uptake and utilization of inositol, melibiose/raffinose, and acetoin

name: Noise – S415
function: Noisy independent transcript S415

name: AcoR – Acetoin
function: Utilization of acetoin, extracellular energy storage

name: DegU – Toxins and Colony Establishment
function: Response to arrested flagellar motor. Secretion of yukE, a homolog of virulence factor EsxA. Production of antitoxins and putative toxin y-genes. Production of hydrophobic biofilm layer and lipoproteins for motility. Many unknown proteins.

name: Noise – Carbon Source Transition 1
function: Likely accounting for noise in the carbon source transition experiments

name: SigM – Membrane Stress
function: General stress proteins, alarmones, lipid carriers and flippases, DNA repair, inhibition of septation. Contains many UTRs and some unknown proteins.

name: Noise – S1235
function: Independent transcript S1235, behaves similar to late sporulation I-modulons

name: FruR – Fructose
function: Fructose uptake and utilization

name: SigG – Sporulation 4
function: Calcium and nutrient delivery to the spore, endospore cortex maturation, lipoproteins, forespore-specific metabolic proteins, many unknown sporulation proteins, stress resistance, proteins required for germination

name: Empty 3
function: Contains no genes

name: CcpA-2 – Low Glucose 2
function: Uptake, utilization, and regulation of alternative carbon sources: TCA intermediates, ribose, maltodextrin, galacto-oligosaccharides, acetoin, gluconate, etc. Suppression of glucose pathways. Stationary phase.

name: PhoP-2 – Phosphate Limitation 2
function: Degradation of wall teichoic acid to salvage phosphate, synthesis of teichuronic acid to replace wall, high-affinity phosphate uptake.

name: LicR – Lichenan
function: Uptake, phosphorylation, and utilization of lechenin, a glucan found in soil

name: TnrA / PucR – Nitrogen Limitation
function: Ammonium uptake, utilization of nitrate and xanthine. Suggests nitrate limitation in the BT condition

name: Noise – LBGexp_1
function: Likely accounting for noise in the first sample of LBG_exp. Top few RNAs are 5' UTRs of glucose metabolism genes

name: PhoP-1 – Phosphate Limitation 1
function: High-affinity phosphate uptake, teichuronic acid production pseudogene.

name: LexA – DNA Repair
function: SOS response for DNA protection and repair

name: CzrA – Toxic Cation Export
function: Resistance to Zn, Cu, Co, Ni, and Cd

name: GlpP – Glycerol
function: Glycerol uptake and utilization

name: Empty 2
function: Contains no genes

name: SigK-2 – Sporulation 6
function: Production of outermost spore coat and crust proteins, mother cell lysis

name: MtrB – Tryptophan
function: Biosynthesis of tryptophan

name: Uncharacterized 5
function: Contains many poorly characterized RNAs with noisy activity

name: TnrA + CodY – Leucine, Methionine, and Threonine
regulator: [TnrA + CodY + ThrR] / [TnrA + CodY + T-box + CcpA + SigA]
function: Synthesis and salvage of leucine, methionine, threonine

name: Noise – S144
function: Likely accounting for noisey RNA S144, an independent transcript

name: SigD – Motility
function: Production of flagella components and export machinery, chemotaxis receptors, use of extracellular energy (polyglutamic acid), regulation of swarming, sporulation inhibitors, cell wall turnover

name: Uncharacterized 6
function: 5’ ends of tRNAs and independent transcripts

name: FadR – Fatty Acids
function: Fatty acid degradation

name: PurR – Purines
function: Synthesis of purine, xanthine and guanine uptake and conversion into purines

name: SigB-2 – General Stress 2
function: Likely accounting for microarray saturation in the ethanol condition of I-modulon SigB 1 by negatively weighting highly expressed ethanol genes

name: CymR / NsrR – Sulfur and Nitrate Respiration
function: Import and utilization of sulfonate and cystine for cysteine production. Nitrite reduction

name: CcpA-1 – Low Glucose 1
function: Uptake and utilization of alternative carbon sources: ribose, sucrose, salicin, beta-glucosides, lichenan,  glucomannon, trehalose, G3P, etc. High expression in exponential phase on LB media

name: ComK – Competence
function: DNA transport, pseudopilus, recombination machinery, and regulatory proteins for competence

name: Noise – S1210
function: Noisy independent transcript S1210

name: Fur – Iron Limitation
function: Production and transport of siderophores for iron chelation, replacement of ferredoxins in the ETC with flavodoxins, RNA chaperones for iron-limited conditions, heme degradation

name: Uncharacterized 4
function: Contains many poorly characterized RNAs with noisy activity

name: SigW – Cell Wall Stress
function: Adaptation to membrane active agents such as cefuroxime, antimicrobials from B. amyloliquefaciens, sdpC, and nisin. Control of membrane fluidity. Contains many unknown proteins.

name: RocR / PutR – Arginine and Proline Utilization
function: Utilization of arginine, ornithine, citrulline and proline as carbon and energy sources

name: Thi-Box – Thiamine
function: Synthesis and uptake of thiamine

name: Fnr – Nitrate Respiration
function: Nitrate respiration and nitrite extrusion

name: HutP – Histidine Utilization
function: Histidine uptake and utilization

name: LevR – Levan and Fructose
function: Fuctose uptake and phosphorylation, degradation of the exopolysaccharide levan into fructose

name: Zur – Zinc Limitation
function: Zinc uptake, zinc metallochaperones, alternatives to zinc-containing proteins

name: Xpf – PBSX Prophage
function: Prophage element that induces production of bacteriocin and cell lysis in response to DNA-damaging agents

name: Uncharacterized 1
function: Contains a SigE/SigG inhibitor, spore coat proteins, translational proteins, oxidative stress response, many RNAs

name: Spβ-2 – SP-β Prophage 2
function: Temperature-responsive SP-beta prophage. Prophage, unknown, and putative metabolic genes. Response to mitomycin.

name: ManR – Mannose
function: Utilization of mannose for cell wall synthesis. Needed for exponential growth in LB media (absent glucose) or in the presence of fructose

name: Noise – Carbon Source Transition 2
function: Likely accounting for noise in carbon source transition and gluconnate experiments

name: S-Box – Methionine
function: Methionine salvage and biosynthesis

name: His – Histidine Synthesis
function: Synthesis of histidine

name: ResD – Oxygen Limitation
function: Anaerobic nitrate respiration, bacteriocin production, heme, cytochrome, and ATP synthesis, copper homeostasis

name: CodY – BCAA Limitation
function: Uptake of di-/oligopeptides, uptake of guanosine, cell wall metabolism

name: SigE / G – Sporulation 3
function: Spore coat production, transcription factor and regulator expression, spore DNA protection, spore stress resistance

name: Yrk – Putative Sulfur Carriers
function: Putative sulfur carriers. High activity under diamide stress

name: AbrB – Transition State
function: Various transition state roles: spore killing, antibiotic resistance, toxin production, metabolism, protein modification, and unknown proteins.

name: CymR – Sulfur
function: Sulfur metabolism in response to oxidative stress. Utilization and detoxification of S-(2-succino)cysteine, methionine-cysteine conversion, siroheme biosynthesis

name: PyrR – Pyrimidines
function: Synthesis of pyrimidines

name: Rex – Overflow Metabolism
function: Overflow metabolism (LDH) and cytochrome BD oxidation  for respiration in anaerobic conditions

name: Uncharacterized 3
function: Contains many poorly characterized RNAs with noisy activity but clear time correlations, especially in sporulation. May be indicative of overall decreased translational activity

name: FrlR – Amino Sugars
function: Amino sugar uptake and metabolism

name: Ybc – Uncharacterized Operon
function: Contains one subunit of NADH dehydrogenase with several unknown genes. Categorized as prophage. Responds to heat shock.

name: SigE – Sporulation 2
function: Spore maturation through core dehydration, nutrient transport and utilization, septum degradation, inner cortex synthesis, and regulator activation

name: Eps – Exopolymeric Substances
function: Biosynthesis of tasA and extracellular polysaccharides, the major components of the biofilm

name: Spo0A – Sporulation 1
function: Initiation of sporulation through sigma factor, transcription factor, and regulatory protein expression, as well as septum formation and chromosome anchoring

name: AhrC – Arginine
function: Uptake and biosynthesis of arginine

name: MalR – Malate
function: Malate uptake and utilization

name: NadR / BirA – NAD and Biotin
function: Biosynthesis of NAD and biotin, plus safA & coxA sporulation proteins and repression of manganese uptake

name: Alb – Antilisterial Bacteriocin
function: Produces and exports subtilosin, which kills anaerobic listeria bacteria

name: ComA – Surfactants
regulator: [ComA + CcpA + TnrA] / [Abh + SigA + ComA + Spx + PhoP + CodY + PerR]
function: Activated during transition to stationary phase (quorum sensing), production of surfactant and exoenzymes to improve nutrient delivery in the biofilm, ComS for activation of competence

name: ImmR – ICEBs1
function: Mobile genetic element that participates in horizontal gene transfer

name: PchR – Pulcherrimin
function: Extracellular synthesis and import of pulcherrimin for iron acquisition

name: GerE / GerR – Mid-late Spore Coat
function: Production of spore coat and crust proteins. Omitted from sporulation analysis because all genes are contained by SigK1 & 2, and activity levels are very noisy in non-sporulating conditions.

name: WapA – Intercellular Competition
function: Activation of WapA and its operon of unknown genes for interspecies toxin delivery

name: SigK-1 – Sporulation 5
function: Production of spore coat and crust proteins, L-sulfolactate production, spore coat cross-linking, stress resistance, many unknown proteins

name: SigB-1 – General Stress 1
function: Survival of general stressors including ethanol, salt, paraquat, heat, and freeze-thaw

name: SknR – Skin Element
function: Prophage element that disrupts the SigK gene but also plays roles in preventing early germination and regulating proliferation. Unknown and toxin resistance genes.
